title.narrative: Improving learning, monitoring and communication technology for the Livelihood Programme

description.narrative:
The partners of the livelihood programme held a regional partner gathering in April 2018 where SIMAS shared the lesson learned from the online monitoring platform and the use of the online learning platform. SIMAS carried out a rapid assessment to identify partner priorities and needs (see documents in webpromise). One of the findings is that partners feel they need continued accompaniment on how to improve tools and skills for using these two online platforms. They mention that they need to improve communication skills in order to write and share more case studies, and write informational notes, and finally partners think that the online monitoring system needs improvement to be more user friendly.
This project aims to improve the Online System for Farm Monitoring (OSFM: (http://monitoreo-finca.cafodca.org/) and the learning exchange platform ((http://cafodca.org/). The online monitoring system and the learning platform needs to improve tools and design for better comprehension and analysis of the data produced. SIMAS will carry out regional courses as well as field visits to each partner across the region. One innovation will be to use digital media to give talks and technical support.
Partners need to work closely on development and implementation of these tools. Due to the complexity and the cost of this system, CAFOD had prioritized in the first phase just two Nicaraguan partners with whom we worked as a pilot project this new system. However, this project is now aimed at all the Central America partners.
